Description: A thin, flat, oval-shaped tortoise-shell bangle.
Curator's comments: Said to be from Saqqara by the Revd. Greville J. Chester, but the provenance is unlikely. His statements of the origin of pieces sold or presented by him to the British Museum are often based on where he acquired them. His 'provenances' are frequently plausible but should always be treated with caution. Companion to bangle (1878,1109.3). It is noticeable that all excavated examples of tortoise-shell bangles which can be dated firmly to the Predynastic Period are open hoops, often with extensive overlapping of the ends. Cf. bangles from Hierakonpolis (New York Metropolitan Museum of Art 35.7.47-9): 'Bulletin of the Metropolitan Museum of Art' 30 (New York, 1935), ii, 43, fig. 10 = W. C. Hayes, 'The scepter of Egypt : a background for the study of the Egyptian antiquities in the Metropolitan Museum of Art' I (New York, 1953), fig. 18; G. A. Reisner, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1907-8’ (Cairo, 1910), pl,66b, nos. 17-18; H. Junker, ‘Bericht über die Grabungen der Akademie der Wissenschaften in Wein auf den Friedhöfen von el-Kubanieh-Süd. Winter 1910-11’ (Vienna, 1919), 96, fig. 55. Moreover, the open-ended form continued to be used by the C-Group people of Nubia: see C. M. Firth, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1908-9’ (Cairo, 1912), ii. pl.37c. no. 9. For a comprehensive catalogue of tortoise-shell bangles from most periods see H. G. Fischer, ‘Ancient Representations of Turtles’ (New York, 1968), 8. n. 14. There are very similar bangles in W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Prehistoric Egypt’ (London, 1920), 31; pl.XXXI. 33-8, but their date is not certain. The only certainly dated examples are New Kingdom: H. Junker, ‘Bericht über die Grabungen der Akademie der Wissenschaften in Wein auf den Friedhöfen von el-Kubanieh-Nord. Winter 1910-11’ (Vienna, 1920), 161: pl.16. no. 24 and Coptic: G. Brunton, ‘Matmar’ (London, 1948), pl.LXIX, 30, 34.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (110)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
